      List<String> get(String header)
      Returns the HTTP response header specified by field.
      boolean isClosed()
      Returns true if a response has been sent, false otherwise.
      boolean isOpen()
      Returns true if no response has been sent yet, false otherwise.

      Sets the response Location HTTP header to the specified path parameter.

      Redirects to the URL derived from the specified path, with specified status.

      Redirects to the URL derived from the specified path, with status 302.

      Sends an empty HTTP response.

      Sends the HTTP response.

      Transfers the file at the given path.

      Sends a JSON Object.

      Sets the response HTTP status code to statusCode and send its string representation as the response body.

      Sets the response's HTTP header field to value.

      Sets the response's HTTP header field to value.
      HttpResponse status(int status)
      Sets the HTTP status for the response.
      HttpResponse type(ContentType type)
      Sets the Content-Type HTTP header to the MIME type provided.

      • end

        public void end()
         throws IOException
        Ends the response process. Use to quickly end the response without any data. If you need to respond with data, instead use methods such as HttpResponse.send()
        Throws:
        IOException

      • isOpen
